sense.name: first section
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] The first part of a process. Includes courses of study, and anything that refers to such a course of study.
sense.examples: The song's introduction is a little slow, but it gets better. I'm taking Introduction to Spanish this semester. The textbook is called "Introduction to Advanced Biophysics".

sense.name: first appearance
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] The first appearance of something or someone, or the act of unveiling something to the world. The beginning of something new, or a debut.
sense.examples: John's introduction to the world of rap music was met with widespread acclaim. They looked forward to the introduction of their new product line.

sense.name: meeting people
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] The formal process by which one person meets another.
sense.examples: Allow us to skip the introductions, gentlemen. I don't talk to people without a formal introduction first. From the moment of their introduction, it was obvious that John and Mary liked each other.

sense.name: proposal
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] The act of proposing a new idea.
sense.examples: The committee resisted the introduction of alternatives to their plan.

sense.name: insertion
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] One thing being put into another. Often scientific.
sense.examples: We began the introduction of the chemical into a fluid medium. The introduction of a virus would decimate this population.

sense.name: creation
sense.commentary: INTRODUCTION[+event] Probably a rare usage. Refers to the invention, initiation, or foundation of something new-- not just its first appearance.
sense.examples: Historians regard the fork as a modern introduction.
